Bonus Terms You Must Know

Before claiming any crash bonus code, understand the terms:

Wagering Requirements (The Big One)

What it is: You must wager the bonus amount X times before withdrawing.

Example: $100 bonus with 30x wagering = $3,000 total bets required.

How crash games contribute:
– Most casinos: 100% (every dollar bet on crash counts toward wagering)
– Some casinos: 50% or 10% (read the terms — these are bad deals)
– Our rule: Only recommend bonuses where crash contributes 100%

Game Restrictions

Red flag: “Bonus only valid on slots” or “Crash games excluded”

What we list: Only bonuses that work on crash games.

Maximum Bet Limits

What it is: While playing with bonus money, you're capped on max bet size.

Typical limits: $5 per bet or 10% of bonus amount (whichever is lower)

Why casinos do this: Prevent bonus abuse (betting huge to clear wagering fast).

Time Limits

Typical: 7-30 days to clear wagering

Expired bonus: If you don't clear wagering in time, bonus funds are forfeited.

Our advice: Don't claim bigger than you can clear. If you can only wager $500/week, don't claim a $5,000 bonus.

Crash-Specific Bonus Strategy

Here's how to maximize crash bonus codes:

1. Start Small (No-Deposit)

  • Claim free offers first (Duelbits $10, Coinpoker $5)
  • Practice crash strategy with house money
  • Build confidence + understand variance

2. First Deposit: Match Your Bankroll

  • Low roller ($50-$100): Cryptorino (100% up to $1,000)
  • Mid roller ($500-$1,000): BC.Game (300% up to $20,000)
  • High roller ($5,000+): Betpanda (200% up to 1 BTC)

3. Optimal Bet Sizing With Bonus

  • Rule: Bet 1-2% of bonus amount per round
  • Example: $1,000 bonus → Bet $10-$20 per round
  • Why: Survive variance without busting before clearing wagering

4. Auto-Cashout Strategy

  • With bonus: Set lower auto-cashout (1.5x-2x) for consistent small wins
  • Goal: Clear wagering steadily, don't chase multipliers

5. Know When to Stop

  • Success: Wagering cleared, bonus withdrawable → Switch to normal play
  • Failure: Down to 20% of bonus → Accept loss, don't chase

Responsible Gambling

Bonuses are leverage, not guaranteed profit.

Reality check:
– House edge still exists (usually 1-3% on crash games)
– Wagering requirements are designed to favor casinos
– Most players don't clear wagering (that's how casinos profit)

Our advice:
– Treat bonuses as extended playtime, not free money
– Never deposit more than you can afford to lose
– Set loss limits before playing
– If bonus hunting feels like work, stop — it's supposed to be fun
